term.title: entrance channel

item.text: The region of a potential-energy surface or hypersurface that corresponds to molecular configurations that are closer in geometry to those of the reactants than to those of the products.

sources.item: PAC, 1996, 68, 149. 'A glossary of terms used in chemical kinetics, including reaction dynamics (IUPAC Recommendations 1996)' on page 165 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199668010149)

term.citation: Citation: 'entrance channel' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.E02148

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
